title: Aniridia: Epidemiology and Demographics
short_description: Clinical document describing the prevalence and demographic distribution of aniridia, a rare eye disorder.
long_description: This clinical research document provides epidemiological information about aniridia, a rare congenital eye condition characterized by the absence or underdevelopment of the iris. The document presents key demographic data indicating that aniridia affects males and females equally, with no gender predisposition. It establishes the disorder's rarity by citing prevalence estimates of approximately 1 in 60,000 to 100,000 live births in the United States, providing important baseline data for understanding the scope and impact of this genetic condition.
